metadata.titel_preek: Midnight in the Kingdom of Death

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The invasion of the Kingdom of Death by the Son of God to liberate humanity from the darkness of Sin and Death.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Son of God
tekstueel_bewijs: The Son of God... has been given over to the realm of night.
He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

object.identificatie: Victory over Death / Eternal Light and Life
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Mandate
tekstueel_bewijs: the light of the Incarnate Word of God comes to shine
whoever believes in me... shall never die
The liturgy is designed to show...
the evangelist wants us to know...
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that enables belief.

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Satan, and the 'Power of Darkness'
tekstueel_bewijs: Death rules there. Satan rules there.
the reign of Death is stark, merciless, irrevocable
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is presented not as a metaphor but as a kingdom/realm with its own 'clasp' and 'reign' that humans cannot escape.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of belief/confession following the revelation of the Resurrection.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Martha
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Confession of Faith ('Yes, Lord; I believe')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human 'believing' is a response to the 'victory already accomplished' by Christ.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus brings light to the world
He arose from the kingdom of Death
The light of the Incarnate Word of God comes to shine
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb
The men run to see for themselves
You will come to know the cold clasp of death

voorbeelden: he must rise from the dead
one thing is for sure: she was not expecting the Resurrection
as yet they did not know the scripture
the few shreds of solace that we are able to snatch

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability to escape death) and Christ's supreme 'pouvoir' (power to rise and carry away spoils).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: S2 (Midnight) → ~S1 (Vain human spices) → ~S2 (Empty tomb) → S1 (Risen Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ physically enters S2 to negate it from within, creating S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is described as a 'merciless' and 'irrevocable' reign.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Christ is the sole actor in the drama of salvation; humans are depicted as grieving, confused, and incapable of effecting their own rescue.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The reign of Death is stark, merciless, irrevocable.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary and the disciples are not models of faith to imitate, but models of human despair and confusion to which God responds.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God acts while Mary is still in the dark.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'doing' is replaced by the gift of 'receiving'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic: Salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative moves logically from the cosmic problem (Death) to the divine solution (Christ's descent/ascent) to the human response (Belief).
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'vain effort' of human spices and the 'accomplished victory' of the Resurrection.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Christological event rather than the internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin and Death are objective powers that 'reign' over the world.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon perfectly maintains Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative program. Human characters are correctly positioned as Receivers.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; appropriate for an Easter Vigil.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology precedes and grounds the call to belief.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It avoids the 'exemplarist' trap by showing that even the first witnesses were incapable of 'believing' until God had already finished the work.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'night' imagery; Greimas shows that 'night' is an actantial Opponent that only a Divine Subject can overcome.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains John 20; Greimas shows how the preacher uses John 20 to re-center the hearer's universe around Christ's agency.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'believing' at the end is a modal competence (Pouvoir) granted by the Object, not a work performed by the Subject.

volledige_subject_lijst: The realm of darkness appears victorious
appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' effectively, ensuring the 'active verbs' of salvation belong to Christ.
